availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eldred Earl Pate (Hancock County, Kentucky, court clerk)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, court clerk. Hancock County native. Attended Greenville College. Clerk of the Hancock County Court and Hancock County Circuit Court from 1862 to 1866.

ab.bibl: “A Popular Minister,” Hartford Herald (Ky), October 5, 1892; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 300; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 12; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 14; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Hancock County, KY, 1863, p. 26, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
